Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2014 11:13AM AymzTX wrote: If you are being treated locally, it might help to get a second opinion at a major cancer center.  I drive 4 hours to MD Anderson on a regular basis to get their opinion when new treatments are suggested by my local oncologist.  This way I feel I'm getting the same care I would at a major cancer center locally.  I also research any treatment well prior to starting it.  Knowledge is power and will help you recognize side effects early.  I read your blog and again am disappointed with the ignorance of doctors...amazing.
Posts.Title: No Longer Trusts My Oncologist or Doctors.. Crazy 11 Days Freedomchild82

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2014 08:13PM AymzTX wrote: I am participating in this trial.  I just got information on it Friday from my oncologist at MD Anderson.  I'm going in for scans on Friday 2/21 and will have to be off chemo for 6 weeks before I can start it on 3/28/2014.  Anyone else participating or have anymore information?  What I have is posted on my blog (added the link from here, also - thanks!). http://aymzbc/blogspot.com
